definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: It is risky to drive that old car around.
sentences.chinese: 开着那台老爷车四处跑还挺危险的。

sentences.english: I have a special passion for that jalopy .
sentences.chinese: 我对那部老爷车有种特殊的感情。

sentences.english: I gave much time to the old car.
sentences.chinese: 我已花了大量心血在这辆老爷车上。

sentences.english: The four-day show kicked off in Vienna on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 当日，为期四天的维也纳老爷车展在当地开幕。

sentences.english: The last time I walked this world, it was buggies and Model Ts.
sentences.chinese: 上次我来这个世界的时候，用的是儿童车和老爷车。

sentences.english: A proud owner poses with his classic car in Trinidad, Cuba.
sentences.chinese: 在古巴特立尼达市一位车主自豪地与他的老爷车合影。

sentences.english: And this looks like an old American car. QED...
sentences.chinese: 而这辆车则看起来比较像美国老爷车。

sentences.english: With the older cars you have to use what I call arm-strong steering.
sentences.chinese: 开老爷车，你得使用我说的那种‘手臂助力方向盘’。

sentences.english: Eg. Where did you get the beat-up old car?
sentences.chinese: 你从哪儿弄来那辆老爷车？

sentences.english: His interest lies in boasting his newly bought old-style car.
sentences.chinese: 他的兴趣在于不断地向人吹嘘他新买的老爷车。

sentences.english: I live in a small house. I drive a beat-up old car.
sentences.chinese: 我住小房子，我开老爷车。

sentences.english: Today, the few that remain are popular with banger racers.
sentences.chinese: 而现在，现存的几辆在老爷车手中也很流行。

sentences.english: His old car bumped down the gravel road.
sentences.chinese: 他那辆老爷车在砾石路上颠簸行驶。

sentences.english: I drive a beat-up old car.
sentences.chinese: 我住小房子，我开老爷车。

sentences.english: The old car bounced along the road.
sentences.chinese: 那辆老爷车在马路上颠簸地行驶着。
他的老爷车发着轰鸣声开走了。

definition: racing bicycle/sporting bicycle/sports car/logging truck/on the job (of a train conductor)
supercar/abbr. to 超跑|超跑[chao1 pao3]
supercar/abbr. for 超級跑車|超级跑车[chao1 ji2 pao3 che1]
locomotive/train engine car/scooter (Tw)/(slang) (Tw) hard to get along with/a pain in the ass/damn!/crap!
